# Project 1_ Kaiyue Wu



1. Use the Random Number generators discussed in the class to do the following:

   (a)  Using the LGM method generate 10,000 Uniformly distributed random numbers on [0,1] and compute the empirical mean and the standard deviation of the sequence.

   <span style="color:blue">In Q1(a), X_0 is set to 6</span>

   ​		<span style="color:blue">mean :  0.5011609332500776</span>

   ​		<span style="color:blue">standard deviation : 0.29044406111428883</span>

   ```python
   LGM mean is 0.5011609332500776, LGM standard deviation is 0.29044406111428883
   ```

   (b)  Use built-in functions of the software you are using to do the same thing as in (a).

   <span style="color:blue">For the built-in function, I empoly <b>np.random.uniform</b> and the result is </span>

   ​		<span style="color:blue">mean is 0.49942371265383917</span>

   ​		<span style="color:blue">deviation is 0.2891098321026936</span>

   ```python
   Built-in function mean is 0.49942371265383917, Built-in function deviation is 0.2891098321026936
   ```

   (c)  Compare your findings in (a) and (b) and comment (be short, but precise).

   <span style="color:blue">Both mean and standard deviation from the two methods are very close to theorical value that means are around 0.5 and standard deviations are around 0.289.</span> 

2. Use the numbers of part (a) of question 1 to do the following:

   (a)  Generate 10,000 random numbers with the following distribution:

   −1 𝑤𝑖𝑡h 𝑝𝑟𝑜𝑏𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑦 0.30 0 𝑤𝑖𝑡h 𝑝𝑟𝑜𝑏𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑦 0.35 1 𝑤𝑖𝑡h 𝑝𝑟𝑜𝑏𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑦 0.20 2 𝑤𝑖𝑡h 𝑝𝑟𝑜𝑏𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑦 0.15

   (b)  Draw the histogram and compute the empirical mean and standard deviation of the sequence of 10,000 numbers generated in part (a).

   <span style="color:blue">mean : 0.2038</span>

   <span style="color:blue">standard deviation : 1.0303715640486202</span>

   ```python
   Empirical mean is 0.2038, Empirical standard deviation is 1.0303715640486202
   ```

   <span style="color:blue">The plot is </span>

   <img src='data:image/png;base64,'></img>

3. Using the LGM method generate Uniformly distributed random numbers on [0,1] to do the following:

   (a)  Generate 1,000 random numbers with Binomial distribution with 𝑛 = 44 and 𝑝 = 0.64. (*Hint*: A random variable with Binomial distribution (𝑛, 𝑝) is a sum of n Bernoulli (𝑝) distributed random variables, so you will need to generate 44,000 Uniformly distributed random numbers, to start with).

   (b)  Draw the histogram. Compute the probability that the random variable X that has Binomial (44, 0.64) distribution, is at least 40: 𝑃 (𝑋 ≥ 40). Use any statistics textbook or online resources for the exact number for the above probability and compare it with your finding and comment.

   <span style="color:blue">The plot is</span>

   <img src='data:image/png;base64,'></img>

   <span style="color:blue">The probability that random variable X has Binomial (44,0.64) distribution P(x>=40) is : 0.0, however, the probability for the exact number should be 0.000048241</span>

   ```python
   The probability of x >= 40 is 0.0
   ```

   <div>
     P(x>=40) = P(x=40) + P(x=41) + P(x=42) + P(x=43) + P(x=44) <br>
     = 0.00004029 + 0.000006987 + 0.0000008873 + 0.00000007337 + 0.000000002964 <br>
     = 0.000048241
   </div>

   <span style="color:blue">The possible explaination might be we only have 1000 sample, which is relatively samll so that we can's observe x>=40. We cna improve the sample size to test if the possibility wiuld change</span>.

4. Using the LGM method generate Uniformly distributed random numbers on [0,1] to:
   (a) Generate 10,000 Exponentially distributed random numbers with parameter 𝜆 = 1.5. 

   <span style="color:blue">For problem 4, I set x_0 in LGM to be 6.</span>

   (b) Compute 𝑃(𝑋 ≥ 1) and 𝑃(𝑋 ≥ 4).

   <span style="color:blue">𝑃(𝑋 ≥ 1) : 0.2256</span>

   <span style="color:blue">𝑃(𝑋 ≥ 4) : 0.0032</span>

   ```python
   The probability of x >= 1 is 0.2256, The probability of x >= 4 is 0.0032
   ```

   (c) Compute the empirical mean and the standard deviation of the sequence of 10,000 numbers generated in part (a). Draw the histogram by using the 10,000 numbers of part (a).

   <span style="color:blue">mean : 0.6673470598512684</span>

   <span style="color:blue">standard deviation : 0.6751481072709264</span>

   ```python
   Empirical mean is 0.6673470598512684, Empirical standard deviation is 0.6751481072709264
   ```

   <span style="color:blue">The plot is</span>

   <img src='data:image/png;base64,'>

5. Using the LGM method generate Uniformly distributed random numbers on [0,1] to:

   (a) Generate 5,000 Normally distributed random numbers with mean 0 and variance 1, by **Box- Muller** Method.

   (b) Now use the **Polar-Marsaglia** method to Generate 5,000 Normally distributed random numbers with mean 0 and variance 1.

   (c) Now compare the efficiencies of the two above-algorithms, by comparing the execution **times** to generate 5,000 normally distributed random numbers by the two methods. Which one is more efficient? If you do not see a clear difference, you need to increase the number of generated realizations of random variables to 10,000, 20,000, etc.

   <span style="color:blue">BM mean: -0.020994735561742948</span>

   <span style="color:blue">BM standard deviation: 1.0104714556847032</span>

   <span style="color:blue">BM execution time: 0.03935813903808594 </span>

   <span style="color:blue">PM mean: -0.03441971190072053</span>

   <span style="color:blue">PM standard deviation: 0.9988391532719084</span>

   <span style="color:blue">PM execution time: 0.030804872512817383</span>

   <span style="color:blue">As we can see, the Polar-Marsaglia method has less execution time than Box- Muller Method, indicating it is more efficient becuase not every pair is used in the algorithm. </span>

   ```python
   The mean for Box- Muller Method normal distributed r.v is -0.020994735561742948
   The mean for Polar-MarsagliaMethod normal distributed r.v is -0.03441971190072053
   
   The standard deviation for Box- Muller Method normal distributed r.v is 1.0104714556847032
   The standard deviation for Polar-Marsaglia Method normal distributed r.v is 0.9988391532719084
   
   The execution time for Box- Muller Method is 0.03935813903808594 
   The execution time for Polar-Marsaglia method is 0.030804872512817383
   ```

​
